Title: Some red states report zero abortions. Doctors and researchers say it's not true

Description: President Trump held separate calls with Russian President Vladimir Putin and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to kick off talks after almost three years or war.

Description: Caseworkers who serve unhoused people are experiencing high rates of burnout. Low pay and the sadness of the work are taking a toll.

Description: The Gaza Strip – ground zero of Israel's war with Hamas – is only about twice the size of Washington, DC. It has about 25 miles of coastline along the Mediterranean Sea, with a population of about 2 million people. Title: Trumps Begins Working to End the War Between Russia and Ukraine
Description: President Trump had separate phone calls with the leaders of Russia and Ukraine on the same day. Following the calls, Trump posted on social media that both leaders want peace and he said that he wanted negotiations on ending the war between Russia and Ukraine to begin immediately. Title: Judge declines to block Trump administration's resignation offer to federal employees
Description: A federal judge ruled that the Trump administration's offer to federal employees to resign now in exchange for pay and benefits through September can go forward. (Image credit: Kayla Bartkowski)

Title: Dozens of CFPB workers are fired as the agency remains shuttered
Description: Dozens of employees at the bureau were fired by email on Tuesday night amid a stop-work order and closure of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau's headquarters. (Image credit: Anna Moneymaker/Getty Images)

Title: The 'Gulf of America' renaming is official — at least within the U.S.

Title: NPR's Adrian Ma remembers girlfriend, Kiah Duggins, who died in DCA plane collision
Description: NPR's Adrian Ma remembers his girlfriend, Kiah Duggins, who died in the American Airlines flight that crashed into the Potomac River in January after a mid-air collision.

Title: Trump says he has renewed U.S. contact with Russia after talk with Putin
Description: President Trump held a lengthy call with Russian President Vladimir Putin. Afterward, he called Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

Title: Sisyphean task' of bringing Marc Fogel home from Russian prison has happy ending
Description: Marc Fogel, a Pennsylvania schoolteacher, has been release from Russian prison. NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with his sister, Anne Fogel, about how the family is feeling now.

Title: A second winter storm brings cold, rain and snow to millions
Description: Heavy West Coast rain means mudslides threaten fire-ravaged California. Millions of Americans elsewhere get snow, rain, extreme cold and some tornadoes. (Image credit: Nam Y. Huh)

Title: A hidden Picasso painting from the early Blue Period is revealed by new technology
Description: Experts analyzing the painting have several theories about why this unidentified woman has remained submerged for more than a century. (Image credit: The Courtauld Institute of Art)

Title: Belarus has released 3 from prison, including an American and a journalist

Description: President Trump's talk of acquiring Greenland has sparked creative proposals, from a bill to rename the island 'Red, White and Blueland' to a satirical petition for Denmark to buy 'Califørnia.' (Image credit: Steffen Trumpf)

Title: Tulsi Gabbard confirmed as director of national intelligence, overcoming skepticism
Description: The former lawmaker faced questions about her level of experience and past comments about autocratic leaders, but ultimately the Senate confirmed her on Wednesday afternoon. (Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)

Title: January wasn't expected to break global temperature records. But it did.
Description: The planet has been shattering heat records for the past two years. That was expected to ease in January—and the fact that it didn't has climate researchers worried. (Image credit: Matilde Campodonico/AP)

Title: Trump says he spoke to Putin about Ukraine war
Description: President Trump said he spoke with Russian President Vladimir Putin about the war in Ukraine and other issues, and that they agreed to visit each other's nations and have their teams start negotiations immediately on the conflict. (Image credit: Evgeniy Maloletka)

Description: Without federal support, American communities will struggle to deal with a challenge as pervasive as climate change, market analysts and environmental advocates say. (Image credit: Al Drago/Getty Images)

Description: NPR asks Dennis Ross, a former U.S. ambassador and Middle East Special Envoy, about hostage release deadlines set by President Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu, as well as other risks to the Gaza ceasefire.

Description: NPR asks Dennis Ross, former U.S. ambassador to Israel, about hostage release deadlines set by President Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu, as well as other risks to the Gaza ceasefire.

Description: Several states, including Missouri, Arkansas and Tennessee, have barred groups from sending free books to prisoners, citing fears of contraband. Advocates say that is not a cause for concern.

Description: Sen. Chris Murphy of Connecticut worries the U.S. public may not won't recognize the ongoing 'constitutional crisis' if they see Democrats regularly collaborating with Republicans. (Image credit: Rod Lamkey)

Description: What does it mean that Elon Musk and his Department of Government Efficiency now have access to the vast federal payments system? NPR asks Natasha Sarin, a former Treasury official under Biden.

Title: Norway's Electric-Vehicle Milestone
Description: 9 out of ten cars sold in Norway are EV's. Government incentives and a commitment to charging stations have made Norway a world leader in electric vehicle use. (Image credit: Bloomberg)

Title: FDA upgrades recall of Lay's potato chips to most serious level
Description: The problem ingredient identified was 'undeclared milk,' which poses a risk to those with severe sensitivities or allergies. (Image credit: Justin Sullivan)

Title: Map: See the aircraft's paths before they collided near Washington, D.C.
Description: Investigators say there are likely no survivors in the deadly aircraft collision that occurred Wednesday evening above the icy waters of the Potomac river. (Image credit: Al Drago)

Title: Wichita reacts to crash of plane that left from its airport
Description: Residents and officials of Wichita, Kan., react to the crash of the commercial flight that left Wichita and collided with a military helicopter Wednesday at Regan National Airport in Washington, D.C.

Title: Rwandan-backed rebels take control of Goma
Description: Rwandan-backed rebels declare they are now in control of the key eastern Congolese city of Goma, as their troops continue to claim more territory in the mineral rich region.

Title: What investigators have revealed about the D.C. plane collision
Description: Investigators are trying to understand why an Army Black Hawk helicopter and American Airlines regional jet collided in mid-air near Washington, D.C. Sixty-seven people were aboard the two aircraft.

Title: Air traffic controller radio offers look into lead-up to midair crash
Description: It will be some time before investigators can offer clear answers to the cause of the midair crash at Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport but air traffic controller audio and radar reviewed by NPR offer some insight into what happened before. (Image credit: Carolyn Kaster)

Title: Olympian Nancy Kerrigan reacts tearfully to skaters' deaths in airline collision
Description: Several members of U.S. Figure Skating were on the American Airlines flight, including members of the Skating Club of Boston. The club held a press conference which included club alum Nancy Kerrigan.

Title: FAA data shows 30 near-misses at Reagan Airport
Description: A commercial flight hit a military helicopter at Washington, D.C.'s Ronald Reagan National Airport Wednesday night. The airport has a history of crashes and near-misses going back decades. (Image credit: Andrew Harnik)

Title: Near-collisions at Reagan National Airport often involve military aircraft
Description: A commercial flight hit a military helicopter at Washington, D.C.'s Ronald Reagan National Airport Wednesday night. The FAA tracks near-collisions at all U.S. airports.

Title: Crowded airspace has been a concern at Reagan National Airport. Here is what to know.
Description: Lawmakers have expressed concerns about congestion in at Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport amid a constricted space. (Image credit: Andrew Harnik)

Title: Former FAA administrator and airline pilot provides analysis on midair collision in D.C. area
Description: Steve Inskeep speaks with former Federal Aviation Administrator Randy Babbitt about the midair collision in Washington, D.C.

Title: What we know about the midair crash near Washington, D.C.
Description: Authorities believe there were no survivors in the accident, which happened as a regional passenger jet was attempting to land Wednesday night at Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport. (Image credit: Kayla Bartkowski)
